text:
Hulk Hogan, born Terry Gene Bollea, is a retired American professional wrestler and entrepreneur, best known for his iconic mustache and bandana. Born on March 12, 1952, in Augusta, Georgia, Hogan grew up in a small town in Florida, where he developed a passion for bodybuilding and weightlifting.

After dropping out of high school, Hogan began competing in local bodybuilding competitions, eventually earning the title of Mr. Tampa Bay in 1976. He went on to train under legendary wrestler Hiro Matsuda and made his professional wrestling debut in 1977.

Hogan's charismatic personality and impressive physique quickly made him a fan favorite, earning him a spot in the World Wide Wrestling Federation (WWWF), now known as WWE. He won his first WWF Championship in 1984, defeating "Rowdy" Roddy Piper, and went on to hold the title a record-breaking eight times.

During his wrestling career, Hogan was part of some of the most memorable rivalries in WWE history, including his epic battles with "Macho Man" Randy Savage, Andre the Giant, and "The Million Dollar Man" Ted DiBiase. He also made history as the first wrestler to win the WWF Championship at WrestleMania, the company's flagship event.

In addition to his wrestling career, Hogan has made appearances in several films and television shows, including "Rocky III," "Suburban Commando," and "Hogan Knows Best," a reality TV series that aired on VH1 from 2005 to 2007.

After retiring from wrestling in 2008, Hogan remained a beloved figure in the world of professional wrestling, making sporadic appearances and participating in various charity events. Despite facing personal struggles, including a high-profile divorce and a series of lawsuits, Hogan remains an iconic figure in the world of sports entertainment.
